description: Erection of single storey rear extension (3.5m in depth, maximum height of no more than 3.5m and eaves height of 2.8m)
decision_conditions: The proposed development, by virtue of the total loss of a mature Beech hedge would result in a harmful impact on the appearance and quality of the surrounding landscape.	What is more, insufficient evidence was provided to demonstrate that the removal of the hedge would not have a detrimental impact on the biodiversity of the area and ecological interests of the site. Therefore, the proposed development would fail to comply with the policies CS8, DM 6 and DM10 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012.

Please provide copies of existing and proposed sections at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing the outline of entire property not just part and showing dimensions of proposed work.

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The photo provided does not clearly show the trees subject to the works, however, the works are not excessie themselves and are to small trees to the rear of the property and not affecting public amnenity. As such the works are acceptable.Recommendation:No objections.

The completion of a satisfactory consultation with the Fire Authority, to show that the proposed means of escape in case of Fire from the building to a place of safety complies with the requirements of Regulation 4: Schedule 1:Part B
